visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing agricultural production comparison between corn and wheat across major producing regions using pattern fills for visual distinction and synthetic data extrapolation for extended categorical analysis
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains two quantitative series (corn/wheat production) across 12 categorical regions. Synthetic data maintains original statistical relationships (corn μ=94,125, σ=124,732; wheat μ=61,342, σ=50,218) while extending coverage to secondary producers through linear extrapolation of continental production trends. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while using pattern fills (per Tufte) ensures accessibility. Cairo's principle of proportional ink is maintained through consistent baseline alignment. Value labels (D3-formatted) provide immediate magnitude reference while patterned fills enable differentiation without color reliance, supporting color-deficient perception.
